intro: Gagea delicatula, commonly known as the slender gagea, is a bulbous perennial plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its small, grass-like leaves and delicate, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically blooms in early spring, producing white or pale blue flowers that are often clustered together. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas or along streambanks. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species in many regions.
